trans-unit.source: Specifies how a rotation occurs with one point of user input.

When you set<xref:System.Windows.Input.ManipulationStartingEventArgs.Pivot%2A> in an event handler for the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.ManipulationStarting> event, the manipulation will contain rotation data when the user uses one finger during a manipulation.
This is to simulate real-world situations where you can use one finger to rotate an object, such as a piece of paper on a table.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ManipulationStartingEventArgs.Pivot%2A> is `null`, the user must use two fingers to cause rotation.
